result.execSummary:
The defendant Junior A Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Classification of Felonies-Class "E", Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow the probation to transfer to Dane County. Court recommends that the mental health unit supervise the probation.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Provide DNA sample.

**Restitution in the amount of $0.00**

As a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
May not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Absolute/maintain sobriety.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.

No alcohol.
No drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Junior A Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements by state, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS  and 6 MONTHS with 90 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and  6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Substance abuse program.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS probation.  Court will allow the probation to transfer to Dane County. Court recommends that the mental health unit superivse the probation.


Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 30 days condition timein the House of Correction. STRAIGHT TIME.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharge); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  


Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Jury trial date of 08/19/2015 vacated.

Defendant Junior A Anderson in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Junior A Anderson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trila. Defense wishes to proceed with plea and sentencing. Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Robbery Treat of Force-Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.05,939.50(1)(e) and 939.50(3)(e), a Class E Felony.
Court ordered bail amended down to $2,500.  All conditions of bail previously set remain.

Attorney Rick Steinberg in court, defendant Junior A Anderson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motoin for bail reduction.    Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Letter from Attorney Rick D. Steinberg filing a Notice of Motion and Defendant's Motion for Bail Reductionl.
Notice of Motion and Defendant's Motion for Bail Reduction.

Certification of  PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing MAY 12,2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY RICK STEINBERG, 12690 W. NORTH AVENUE, #C, BROOKFIELD, WI 53005. kl

Defendant Junior A Anderson in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Junior A Anderson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Maciejewski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Jalen S aand  JES.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Junior A Anderson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Junior A Anderson in custody.  
Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
